title: Suns' Booker agrees to historic $145M extension
content: Phoenix Suns superstar Devin Booker agreed to a two-year, $145 million maximum contract extension with the franchise through the 2029-30 season, the highest annual extension salary in NBA history, CAA's Jessica Holtz and Melvin Booker told ESPN.

title: MMA's Askren 'died' 4 times amid transplant bid
content: Former MMA star Ben Askren, who recently underwent a double lung transplant, said in a post on social media Wednesday that he has "no recollection" and "died four times" over the past six weeks leading up to and during the transplant process.

title: NFLPA head works for firm OK'd to invest in NFL
content: Lloyd Howell Jr. joined the firm in March 2023, three months before the NFLPA hired him to be the players' chief representative in relations with the league.

title: LPGA's Hull collapses on tee box, WDs from Evian
content: Charley Hull, a two-time winner on the LPGA Tour, withdrew from the Evian Championship in France on Thursday after collapsing on the tee box of the 4th hole due to illness.

title: Vikes pass rusher Turner scammed out of $240K
content: Vikings outside linebacker Dallas Turner was allegedly a victim of a bank fraud scheme that resulted in the theft of $240,000.

title: Messi scores 2, makes MLS history in Miami win
content: Lionel Messi added another record to his list of career achievements as he scored a pair of goals to lead Inter Miami CF to a 2-1 win over the New England Revolution.

title: Former Jazz coach and GM Layden dies at age 93
content: Frank Layden, who led the Jazz to their first playoff appearance and was part of the front office that selected John Stockton and Karl Malone, has died.

title: We graded the offseason: Here's who crushed it and flubbed it, from the Rams (A) to the Saints (D)
content: We handed out offseason report cards to all 32 NFL teams, factoring in signings, extensions, trades, draft picks, hirings -- you name it.

title: The perfect trade deadline addition for every MLB contender
content: A star outfielder to the NL West? A powerful slugger dealt to New York? We make moves for every World Series hopeful.

title: College football's top 25 teams have their archvillains and we have a pick for each
content: These are the players, coaches, teams and concepts that every squad in our Way-Too-Early Top 25 will be looking out for in 2025.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands heading into the All-Star break
content: The Blue Jays and Cubs debut at their highest rankings of 2025, while the Yankees' fall continues. Here's who's hot -- and who's not -- ahead of baseball's midseason break.

title: Two A's and how many F's?! Midseason grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: From the contenders acing 2025 to the first-half failures, we take a look at every club's performance.

title: The extraordinary mystery of the Tigers' Tarik Skubal
content: "I wasn't good until I was 26," the All-Star pitcher says. How he rose from Little League lore to Cy Young.

title: From adding talent to losing captains: NHL teams that changed the most this offseason
content: From the Sharks to the Stars, here are 12 teams most impacted by offseason moves -- for better and for worse.

title: New East tiers: How injuries, offseason movement reshaped the conference
content: From injured superstars to play-in teams making major splashes, Chris Herring runs down every team's outlook for 2025-26.

title: Who are the NFL's best safeties? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best safeties in the NFL? Execs, coaches and scouts from around the league ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: What the Gold Cup revealed about the USMNT's World Cup hopes
content: The summer got off to a rocky start for the U.S. men's national team, but by the end of the Gold Cup, Mauricio Pochettino's foundations had taken shape.

title: Brentford's Nørgaard completes move to Arsenal
content: Brentford captain Christian Nørgaard has completed a transfer to Arsenal, the north London club announced.

title: PSG trounces Madrid, Mbappé to reach CWC final
content: Fabián Ruiz scored twice and Ousmane Dembélé added a goal and an assist as Paris Saint-Germain eliminated Real Madrid and Kylian Mbappé from the FIFA Club World Cup by sailing to a 4-0 semifinal win on Wednesday.

title: Madrid target signings as Modrić exits - Alonso
content: Xabi Alonso has said Real Madrid are still looking to make additions to the squad for next season, after their defeat to Paris-Saint Germain in the Club World Cup.

title: Return of 'best player' Dembélé 'critical' for PSG
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique will hope to count on striker Ousmane Dembélé for Sunday's Club World Cup finale against Chelsea, after a stunning 4-0 thrashing over Real Madrid in the tournament's penultimate stage.

title: Henderson leaves Ajax; next move unknown
content: Jordan Henderson's exit from Ajax has been confirmed with the England midfielder describing it as an honour "to represent this incredible institution."

title: James best at Euros for magic moments - Bronze
content: ZURICH -- Lucy Bronze has said there is no one as good as England teammate Lauren James at Euro 2025 for creating chances out of nothing.

title: How Kika Nazareth's Barcelona connections can help Portugal take a shot at history
content: Kika Nazareth faced a long road just to be playing at the Euros. Now, the superstar will be calling on all her talent -- and Barça teammates -- to help Portugal qualify.

title: Who is Red Bull's new boss, and can he keep Max?
content: In the wake of Red Bull's bombshell decision to sack Christian Horner this week, it was easy to miss the name of the man replacing him: Laurent Mekies.

title: Katie Taylor ready to complete Amanda Serrano trilogy at MSG
content: With her junior welterweight title on the line in a legendary rivalry, the champ reflects on a life in boxing.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: 50 days, 50 states: Durant, Reese headline top hoopers from D.C.-area high schools
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of D.C., Maryland and Virginia based on career achievements, legacy and lasting impact on the game.

title: Wrexham's Australia and NZ tour diary: 'They didn't know us 20 years ago, but they certainly do now'
content: Plenty has changed for Wayne Jones, one of the breakout stars of the "Welcome To Wrexham" documentary series, and his beloved team since the last time he was in Australia back in 2005.

title: Wrexham reveal 2025-26 home kit: Will they reach the Premier League with it?
content: Wrexham will have a fresh look when they return to English football's second tier after 43 years away.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal submit bid for Chelsea's Noni Madueke
content: Arsenal have made an initial offer for Chelsea's Noni Madueke. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Is the NWSL's push to expand to 32 teams like the NFL feasible, or all talk?
content: "Crazy," "dangerous" or inevitable? The NWSL's commissioner vows to follow the NFL's path to 32 teams. But questions linger, including from execs inside the league.

title: Inside the shift in evaluating MLB draft catching prospects
content: MLB's 2023 rules changes are influencing how the position is taught, played, coached, scouted at all levels.

title: 5,000 Street Dogs In Bengaluru Will Now Get Chicken And Rice Diet Every Day
content: BBMP announces decision to feed street dogs, once a day, serving them with chicken, rice, and other forms of nutritious meals. About 5000 dogs will be fed on a daily baisis. This project is estimated to cost almost 3 crore annually.

title: Relief For Democracy: Congress On Top Court Suggestion On Bihar Voter List Revision
content: The Congress on Thursday said the Supreme Court's suggestion that the Election Commission (EC) should allow Aadhaar cards, voter-ID cards and ration cards in the Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Bihar has come as a "relief for

title: Tennis Player Radhika Yadav Shot Dead By Father Over Her Instagram Reels
content: A father shot his daughter dead in Gurugram's Sushant Lok today. The victim, Radhika Yadav, was a tennis player and lived in Sushant Lok-phase 2 of Gurugram.

title: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Welcomes Supreme Court Order On Poll Roll Revision
content: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chowdhary on Thursday said the Supreme Court allowing the Election Commission of India to continue with its Special Intensive Revision (SIR) was a welcome step and asserted that its implementation was necessary to

title: Video: Khalistani Terrorists Open Fire At Kapil Sharma's Cafe In Canada
content: At least nine shots have been fired at comedian Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada, just days after it was inaugurated. Khalistani terrorist Harjit Singh Laddi has taken responsibility for the shooting, in which no one was injured.

title: Man, 25, Dies Of Electrocution While Crossing Waterlogged Gurugram Street On Bike
content: A 25-year-old man returning home on a bike from a gymnasium late on Wednesday night was electrocuted to death while crossing a waterlogged street in Gurugram, said the police.

title: Himachal Chief Minister Announces Rs 7 Crore Relief For Disaster-Hit Mandi
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Thursday announced an immediate relief amount of Rs 7 crore to carry out restoration work in disaster-affected areas of Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district

title: Saudi Foreign Executions Top 100 After 2 More Put To Death
content: Saudi Arabia put two Ethiopians to death Thursday, pushing this year's number of foreigners executed past 100 -- a spike in capital punishment that human rights groups have strongly condemned.

title: Assets Worth Over Rs 200 Crore Attached In Manav Bharti University Fake Degree Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) in Shimla has provisionally attached seven immovable properties worth Rs 1.74 crore (as per sale deed value) under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002.

title: Bill To Tackle "Urban Naxalism" Passed By Maharashtra Assembly
content: The Maharashtra legislative assembly on Thursday passed by a voice vote the Special Public Security bill which seeks to prevent unlawful activities of Left Wing extremist organisations with focus on urban Naxalism.

title: Pilot Killed In Jaguar Crash In Rajasthan Had Become Father A Month Ago
content: Squadron Leader Lokendra Singh Sindhu, one of the two Indian Air Force (IAF) pilots who were killed in a crash of a Jaguar fighter jet near Churu in Rajasthan on Wednesday,

title: Silver Bars Worth Over Rs 1 Crore Found In 'Hidden Chamber' Inside Scorpio In Odisha
content: Silver bars weighing over 100 kg were seized from a hidden chamber inside a Mahindra Scorpio in Odisha's Sambhalpur.

title: Pak-Based Terrorist's House Seized In Jammu And Kashmir's Kupwara
content: As a part of an ongoing crackdown on terrorist infrastructure, property of a Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist was seized in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara on Wednesday, the police said.

title: Name - Abhilasha Kumari, Photo - Nitish Kumar's: A Curious Voter ID In Bihar
content: Name: Abhilasha Kumari, Photo - A candid picture of Nitish Kumar - this curious mix-up was seen on a 30-year-old woman's voter ID in Bihar.

title: "Shashi Tharoor As Chief Minister" Survey Cooked Up: Kerala Ex Minister
content: A former minister in Kerala from the Congress has dismissed a survey that indicated party colleague Shashi Tharoor is the most preferred candidate for the chief minister's post. The next assembly election in Kerala will be held in 2026.

title: Karnataka High Court Orders Notice To Siddaramaiah's Wife In MUDA Case
content: The Karnataka High Court on Thursday issued directions to serve notice to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife, B.M. Parvathi, in connection with the Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA) scam.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can India Help Pull Putin Away From Xi? Or, Should It?
content: In recent weeks, many in India have wondered if it was right to rely more on the West in recent years and weaken relations with its old-time, traditional ally, Russia.

title: Drunk Man Drives Car Into Tejashwi Yadav's Motorcade In Bihar, Arrested
content: A man has been arrested for taking his car into the motorcade of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav under the influence of alcohol in Patna district of dry Bihar, police said on Thursday.

title: Government's Big Move To Check Inflated Hospital Bills Due To Insurers: Report
content: India plans to bring an existing health insurance claims portal under the finance ministry and insurance regulator to curb overcharging by healthcare providers, a government source told Reuters.

title: How Trump Administration Used Shadowy Website To Target Activists For Deportation
content: The Trump administration had taken the assistance of an anonymously-run pro-Israel website for identifying pro-Palestine academics, in order to deport them, according to newly unsealed court documents. The website has been accused of doxxing.

title: Pakistan in crisis: Baloch rebels launch 'Op Baam'; military, govt sites hit in major offensive
content: The Balochistan Liberation Front (BLF) launched a series of coordinated attacks across multiple districts of Balochistan, targeting government and military installations. Claiming responsibility for "Operation Baam (Dawn)," the BLF vowed a new phase in their fight against the Pakistani state. The attacks disrupted communication lines and damaged infrastructure, highlighting the fragile security situation in the region.

title: Multiple shots fired at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada: Reports
content: Kapil Sharma's new restaurant, KAP'S CAFE, in Surrey, Canada, was targeted in a gunfire incident late Wednesday. Preliminary reports confirm multiple shots were fired, but no injuries occurred. Authorities have launched an investigation, sealing off the area. Harjit Singh Laddi, allegedly linked to Babbar Khalsa International, claimed responsibility, citing anger over Sharma's alleged remarks as the motive.

title: 'Udaipur Files': Delhi HC stays release of film; urges petitioners seeking ban to approach Centre
content: The Delhi High Court has put a hold on the release of 'Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder,' which was scheduled for July 11. This decision comes as Jamiat Ulema-i-Hind seeks a review of the film's certification, arguing it could stir communal discord. The stay remains in effect until the Central Government addresses the revision application.

title: IND vs ENG: Nasser Hussain gives latest update on Pant injury— Will he bat?
content: During the ongoing Test, Indian wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant sustained a painful injury to his left index finger while attempting to stop a delivery. Nasser Hussain reported that Pant split his fingernail, but thankfully, the finger isn't broken. Despite receiving treatment, Pant left the field, and Dhruv Jurel, who has prior experience, took over behind the stumps.

title: Microsoft Outlook down: Users unable to access email and other services
content: Microsoft Outlook is experiencing a widespread global outage, preventing numerous users from accessing their mailboxes across various platforms since approximately 3:50 AM IST. Reports indicate login failures and server connection problems, with users encountering errors like 'Something went wrong' or 'invalid licenses.

title: Tragedy in Gurugram: Who was Radhika Yadav? Indian tennis player shot dead by father
content: In a tragic incident, 25-year-old tennis player Radhika Yadav was allegedly shot dead by her father at their Gurugram residence on Thursday. Police reports indicate a domestic altercation preceded the shooting, with some media suggesting disapproval of her social media activity as a possible motive. Radhika, a rising star in Indian tennis, held impressive ITF and Haryana doubles rankings.

title: State-level tennis player shot dead by father in Gurugram
content: In Gurugram's Sector 57, a state-level tennis player, Radhika Yadav, was allegedly shot dead by her father, Deepak Yadav, at their residence. The 25-year-old was shot in the back while cooking, succumbing to her injuries on the spot. Deepak Yadav has been arrested and accused of murder, with police investigating the motive behind the crime.

title: Centre planning big move to curb overcharging by hospitals: Report
content: India plans to tighten control on hospital billing. The National Health Claims Exchange may be jointly supervised by the finance ministry and IRDAI. This aims to reduce inflated treatment costs. The move seeks to make health insurance more affordable. Rising healthcare costs and insurance premiums are major concerns. The government hopes to enhance insurers' bargaining power.

title: Zohran Mamdani called 'Islamist'; 100+ startup founders write open letter
content: An open letter signed by numerous startup founders and tech workers demands Sequoia Capital take action against partner Shaun Maguire for his Islamophobic remarks against NYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani. Maguire's comments sparked outrage, leading to calls for a public apology, investigation, and hate speech policies. Instead of apologizing, Maguire has doubled down, further escalating the controversy with divisive rhetoric.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Not on Lord's Honours Board?' — Sachin corrects MCC prez
content: Sachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at the MCC Museum in Lord's, coinciding with the India-England Test. During the ceremony, Mark Nicholas playfully noted Tendulkar's absence from the Lord's Honours Board, prompting Tendulkar to recall his century in a 1998 charity match against a formidable bowling attack.

title: IND vs ENG: Sachin opens up on Gill's captaincy, sends heartfelt Guru Purnima message
content: Sachin Tendulkar marked the start of the third India-England Test at Lord's by ringing the iconic bell and praising Shubman Gill's calm and composed leadership. He lauded Gill's excellent form with the bat and India's comeback after their initial Test loss.

title: Who is Priya Nair? HUL appoints new CEO & MD; Rohit exits after two years
content: Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL) has appointed Priya Nair as its new CEO and MD for a five-year term, effective August 1, 2025, succeeding Rohit Jawa. Nair, currently President, Beauty & Wellbeing at Unilever, brings extensive experience from various roles within HUL and Unilever. Jawa steps down on July 31 after leading the company through challenging market conditions.

title: Elon Musk reacts as Bill Gates again raises alarm on USAID funding cut killing children
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: Vadodara bridge collapse: Gujarat CM suspends four officials
content: Following the collapse of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge over the Mahisagar river in Vadodara, Gujarat's Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel has suspended four government officials. The incident, which occurred on Wednesday, resulted in sixteen fatalities and several injuries. Authorities are investigating the cause of the collapse, while police have registered an accidental death complaint.

title: 'Magnesia, Galveaisa': Punjab CM's odd jab at PM Modi's foreign tours
content: Bhagwant Mann, Punjab's Chief Minister, criticized Narendra Modi's recent five-nation tour. Mann mocked the Prime Minister's visits to smaller countries. He suggested Modi prioritizes foreign trips over domestic issues. Mann mentioned fictional countries to highlight obscure destinations. Modi's tour included Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia. The tour aimed to strengthen diplomatic ties and promote economic cooperation.

title: Inside Chhangur Baba's illegal 'empire': Mansion with power station, imported marble — now bulldozed
content: In Balrampur, the district administration demolished an illegal mansion belonging to Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, accused of mass religious conversions. Authorities arrested Chhangur Baba and his associate, Neetu, uncovering a network that allegedly coerced individuals into converting, particularly Hindu women. Investigations revealed foreign funding and numerous international trips, prompting a multi-agency probe into the extensive operation.

title: NFL wife Allison Kuch swaps glam for Play-Doh in relatable glow-up
content: Allison Kuch, influencer and wife of Isaac Rochell, is embracing motherhood. Her content has shifted from glamorous photos to relatable parenting moments. She shares everyday hacks and humorous observations. Kuch documents her journey with Rochell, from college romance to NFL life. They met in college, married in 2021, and welcomed their daughter in 2023.

title: Tom Brady, Sofia Vergara spark dating buzz after Ibiza yacht photo
content: Tom Brady and Sofia Vergara are fueling dating rumors after being spotted together in Ibiza, Spain, following their initial connection at Jeff Bezos's wedding. The pair, both recently divorced, were seen on a luxury yacht and enjoying an intimate dinner, sparking speculation of a blossoming "summer romance." Fans and media are closely watching as the sightings intensify.

title: Wife weeps in church: Jason Adam’s All-Star call mistaken for trade
content: Jason Adam's All-Star Game selection led to an emotional scene at church when his wife, Kelsey, mistakenly believed a missed call from his manager meant he was traded. Overwhelmed, she reacted strongly, only to discover the joyous news of his All-Star nomination alongside Padres teammates Fernando Tatis Jr. and Manny Machado.

title: 3 lines, 3 rooms, 3 portraits: Inside Cambodia's digital arrest scam hub
content: A cybercrime call center in Cambodia, employing a tiered system to defraud victims, has been exposed following the arrest of Khushi Chaudhary. The scam involved posing as FedEx employees, law enforcement, and government officials to extort money from individuals through 'digital arrests.' Victims were coerced into transferring large sums, with scammers enjoying lavish rewards and promotions based on their success.

title: 'Consider Aadhaar, voter ID, ration card': SC refuses to stay Bihar voter revision; what EC said
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to consider Aadhaar, Voter ID, and Ration cards for Bihar's electoral roll revision, raising concerns about the timing with upcoming elections. The court questioned the EC's focus on citizenship verification, typically a Home Ministry matter.

title: Islamophobia definition row: Rayner backs down amid backlash
content: The controversy erupted after Rayner’s office launched a consultation to craft an official government definition of Islamophobia, appointing a 16-member working group known as the “Islamophobia Council” to tackle anti-Muslim hatred. The proposed working definition, based on a 2018 parliamentary report, described Islamophobia as “a type of racism targeting expressions of Muslimness.”

title: Watch: Houthi's attack, sink massive ship in Red Sea; 10 rescued, 4 dead
content: A rescue team saved ten crew members from the Red Sea after a Houthi attack sank the Eternity C, a Liberian-flagged, Greek-operated vessel. Four crew members died, and fifteen remain missing, with the Houthis claiming to hold some. The ship sank on Wednesday after two days of attacks.

title: Eiza González’s 'love of my life' message after Dimitrov's Wimbledon injury
content: At Wimbledon 2025, Grigor Dimitrov had to retire due to a pectoral muscle injury. This happened during his fourth-round match against Jannik Sinner. Dimitrov was leading when the injury occurred. His girlfriend, Eiza Gonzalez, posted a heartfelt message on Instagram. She expressed her pride and support for Dimitrov. Her message quickly gained attention online.

title: Donor threat puts Bill Belichick's UNC job in danger over Jordon Hudson
content: Bill Belichick's relationship with Jordon Hudson is reportedly causing concern at the University of North Carolina, where he was expected to take on a new role. A major donor is allegedly threatening to withdraw funding due to the 48-year age gap. Faculty members have also voiced their disapproval, questioning the university's priorities in hiring Belichick.

title: Magic Johnson dines with longtime friends and family on lavish vacation
content: Magic Johnson, the NBA legend, is vacationing in Monaco with his wife and friends, indulging in the city's culinary delights. He recently dined at Mamo Michelangelo, enjoying a variety of dishes from pizzas to seafood. Johnson, who owns stakes in several sports teams, is taking a well-deserved break after the NBA Finals, as seen through his social media posts.

title: Surya at Big W: 'Not easy' - Batter reveals tennis shot he wants to try in cricket
content: Suryakumar Yadav, India's T20 captain, graced Wimbledon with his presence alongside his wife, Devisha Shetty. He charmed fans with his witty response to a tennis question, expressing his desire to replicate the 'tweener' shot in cricket. As Yadav enjoyed the matches, Novak Djokovic advanced to the Wimbledon semi-finals, continuing his impressive run at the age of 38.

title: 'Still hanging...': Epstein’s eerie final words revealed by close friend
content: Michael Wolff revealed Jeffrey Epstein's eerie final message, 'Still hanging around,' hours before his death in jail. Despite a DOJ report ruling it suicide, conspiracy theories persist, fueled by Epstein's connections to powerful figures. Trump's past association with Epstein resurfaced, while his communications director vehemently dismissed Wolff's claims as fabricated.

title: Centre clears Rs 1,066-cr relief fund for flood-hit states
content: The central government has approved Rs 1,066.80 crore in relief for states affected by floods and landslides, allocating funds from the State Disaster Response Fund to Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Kerala, and Uttarakhand.

title: 6-yr-old sold to marry 45-yr-old; Taliban says: ‘Wait until she’s 9’
content: A six-year-old Afghan girl in Helmand province was forced into marriage with a 45-year-old man due to her family's financial struggles. While Taliban authorities intervened, they instructed the parties to postpone the marriage until the girl turns nine, sparking international condemnation. This incident has intensified concerns about the Taliban's commitment to protecting women's and children's rights in Afghanistan.

title: When Ratan Tata borrowed money from Amitabh Bachchan at Heathrow Airport
content: Amitabh Bachchan fondly remembered Ratan Tata's humility on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati,' recounting an incident at Heathrow Airport where Tata borrowed money for a phone call. Bachchan also shared another instance of Tata's modesty, surprising a friend by asking for a ride home. Beyond personal interactions, Tata's Tata Infomedia Ltd. backed Bachchan's film 'Aetbaar'.

title: 'Rooting for our team': Bobby Deol meets Rohit Sharma, cheers India for Lord's Test
content: Bobby Deol showed his support for Team India, meeting captain Rohit Sharma in London before the crucial third Test against England at Lord's. Deol's Instagram post, featuring a photo with Sharma, quickly went viral as he wished the team well. England won the toss and chose to bat, with India bringing back Jasprit Bumrah into the playing XI.

title: Trump labels Afghan exit 'most embarrassing', calls Milley 'idiot'
content: Donald Trump has criticised the Afghanistan troop withdrawal. He called it an embarrassing moment in US history. Trump questioned Mark Milley's actions. He mentioned the abandonment of military equipment. Trump alleged China controls Bagram Airbase. Afghan experts oppose the return of US troops. The US withdrew troops in August 2021. The Taliban regained control after the withdrawal.

title: 'Is the bird becoming a parrot?': Cong mocks Tharoor over Emergency remark
content: A fresh divide has emerged within the Congress party as MP Manickam Tagore criticizes Shashi Tharoor's remarks on the Emergency era, specifically regarding Sanjay Gandhi's role. Tagore's veiled jab, questioning Tharoor's alignment with BJP narratives, follows Tharoor's article describing the Emergency as a "dark chapter.

title: Haryana shocker: Told to get a haircut, students kill school principal
content: In a shocking incident in Haryana's Hisar district, two minor students allegedly stabbed their school principal to death. The principal of Kartar Memorial Senior Secondary School had reprimanded them for not cutting their hair and instructed them to maintain discipline. Police have registered a case and are searching for the students, while also investigating potential external influences.

title: IND vs ENG: Kohli to be at Lord's? Karthik guesses with Tendulkar in attendance
content: Dinesh Karthik speculated about Virat Kohli's potential attendance at the Lord's Test, citing Kohli's London residence and recent involvement with the Indian team. Sachin Tendulkar graced the occasion, ringing the bell and posing by his portrait. England won the toss and chose to bat against India, with Bumrah's return marking a key change. The series stands level at 1-1.

title: IND vs ENG: From visiting Lord's as teenager' - Sachin gets emotional
content: Sachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at the MCC Museum at Lord's, marking a full-circle moment for the legendary cricketer. Tendulkar reminisced about his early visits to Lord's, recalling the inspiration he drew from India's 1983 World Cup victory.

title: NBA trade buzz: Lakers may part ways with 4x champion in multi-team deal
content: NBA is abuzz with a potential blockbuster trade involving LeBron James. The Lakers are reportedly considering a three-team deal with the Mavericks and Jazz. Dallas would unite James with former teammates Kyrie Irving and Anthony Davis. The Lakers would gain depth with players like Klay Thompson and draft assets. Utah would reacquire Jarred Vanderbilt, focusing on their rebuild.

title: Gabrielle Union glows in new family photo; Dwyane Wade embraces her and daughter Kaavia
content: Gabrielle Union shared a heartwarming Instagram story featuring Dwyane Wade and their daughter Kaavia by a bonfire during a vacation. The image captured a tender family moment, with Wade holding Kaavia and gently touching Gabrielle. This simple yet powerful display of love and connection resonated with fans, highlighting the couple's enduring bond and commitment to family.

title: 'Golgappa can't become phuchka': BJP, TMC clash over 'Bangladeshis' in Delhi
content: A political clash has erupted between the BJP and TMC over allegations of Bengali residents in Delhi being unfairly labeled as "Bangladeshis." TMC accuses BJP of a "witch hunt" against Bengalis in Vasant Kunj, alleging denial of basic amenities. BJP defends the action as enforcement of the law against illegal settlements, citing the recent apprehension of 26 illegal Bangladeshis in the area.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce spent a private and luxurious Fourth of July
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce spent a luxurious, private Fourth of July weekend at the exclusive Yellowstone Club in Montana, known for its celebrity clientele like Mark Zuckerberg and Tom Brady. The couple's low-key celebration follows Swift's extensive tour, with sources indicating she's enjoying downtime with Kelce, focusing on music, and family.

title: 'With a good heart...': Prithvi Shaw shares cryptic post as he parts ways with Mumbai
content: India batter Prithvi Shaw's recent cryptic Instagram post has fueled speculation following his departure from the Mumbai domestic cricket team. After being dropped from Mumbai's Ranji Trophy squad and failing to secure a spot in the Vijay Hazare Trophy team, Shaw will now represent Maharashtra in the upcoming domestic season.

title: Trade deal talks: India takes strong stand, plans retaliatory tariffs against US
content: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the United States under WTO regulations, responding to American duties on steel and aluminium imposed as safeguard measures. This action, impacting US imports worth $7.6 billion, comes amidst ongoing trade deal talks between the two nations.

title: Bangladesh special tribunal indicts Hasina for 'crime against humanity'
content: Sheikh Hasina, the former prime minister of Bangladesh, faces indictment. This is regarding the deaths of protestors during an uprising last year. A tribunal accepted charges of crimes against humanity against her. The charges relate to a mass protest where many students died. An audio recording suggests Hasina ordered a deadly crackdown. The interim government seeks her extradition from India.

title: Lord's Test: Azharuddin backs India's 'superior' attack; Bumrah returns
content: Ahead of the Lord's Test, Mohammed Azharuddin lauded India's bowling attack, especially with Jasprit Bumrah's return, deeming it superior to England's. Team India, boosted by their massive Birmingham victory, aims to capitalise on Shubman Gill's stellar form. England, opting to bat after winning the toss, recalled Jofra Archer.

title: 'Today's India not India of 1975': Tharoor calls Emergency 'dark chapter'
content: Shashi Tharoor's critique of the 1975 Emergency, particularly Sanjay Gandhi's sterilization campaigns, has stirred debate within the Congress party. His article in Deepika highlights the fragility of democracy and the need for vigilance against authoritarian tendencies. This comes amid existing tensions between Tharoor and the party leadership, further fueled by differing views and public statements.

title: ITI may sell some land to repay bank loan of ₹1,500 crore
content: Scindia said a monetization plan for ITI being worked on to raise money to fund the developmental and expansion activities of the PSU’s digital technology and communication business

title: LSGD reconstitutes audit monitoring committees
content: Move is to ensure timely completion of audit reports of local bodies at the district and State levels

title: Chittoor Collector urges parents to play responsible role in moulding children
content: Highlights that the State government is spending around ₹5,000 per student every month to provide quality education during the Mega PTM 2.0 in Rompicherla mandal

title: Municipal dept. prepares action plan to improve citizen satisfaction in urban bodies of A.P.
content: MA&UD set targets for 17 urban local bodies and 77 municipalities in the State with regard to door-to-door garbage collection, garbage dump clearance and drain de-silting

title: KSRTC to launch night service using double-decker bus with collapsible roof
content: Industries Minister P. Rajeeve will inaugurate the service, which is being launched as part of an initiative to promote budget tourism

title: Sakambari festival celebrated grandly at Srisailam
content: 3,000 kg of vegetables — nearly 100 ash gourds, more than 2,000 lemons and various varieties of leafy vegetables — were used to decorate the deities and the temple, says temple executive officer

title: Division Bench of Kerala HC dismisses appeal by State government challenging order that quashed results of KEAM 2025
content: Several students had approached the High Court alleging that the ranking procedure was amended on the date of publication of the rank list

title: VMC Commissioner moots odour control units near sewage treatment plants
content: Dhyanachandra inspects STP at Ramalingeswara Nagar and seeks a report on odour levels before and after the installation of the control unit

title: Tennis player shot dead by father in Gurugram apparently over social media post
content: Radhika Yadav, sustained three bullet injuries after her father Deepak Yadav shot her at point-blank apparently angered by a “reel” on social media, police said

title: 211 child and adolescent labourers rescued in A.P.
content: Following the directions of Commissioner of Labour, task force committees conduct drive from June 1 to 31, and rescue 21 children and 190 adolescent labourers

title: Centre for lasting solution to drought in Rayalaseema, says Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Promising complete support, he asks officials to coordinate and formulate strategic action plans by leveraging Central government schemes to the fullest extent

title: CREDAI Hyderabad announces Property Show 2025 from August 15 to 17
content: Property registrations in Hyderabad crossed ₹4,300 crore in May 2025, marking a 14% year-on-year increase

title: Lokesh sets ambitious goals for education reforms in A.P.
content: Our key reforms include setting up of 9,600 One-Class-One-Teacher Model Primary Schools, curbing the burden of school bags with semester-wise textbooks, and money transfers to the accounts of 67.27 lakh mothers under Thalliki Vandanam, says the Education Minister during the Mega Parent-Teacher Meeting 2.0, which he claimed witnessed participation of over 2.3 crore people in the State, setting a national record

title: State medical council penalises doctor for advertising unrecognised qualification
content: Payyannur branch of Indian Medical Association files complaint against Kannur doctor alleging that he cited PG Diploma and certificate courses, which are not recognised medical degrees, on billboard advertising his practice

title: Palaniswami charges DMK government with nepotism and corruption
content: He also alleges irregularities and lack of services at the Arulmigu Annamalaiyar temple in Tiruvannamalai

title: Supreme Court tells Election Commission of India to consider Aadhaar, EPIC, ration card for Bihar voter roll revision
content: The top court allows Special Intensive Revision to continue and to examine powers, process and timing of the exercise

title: Will accept court verdict and publish revised KEAM rank-list at the earliest, says Higher Education Minister R. Bindu
content: Kerala High Court uphold Single Judge order the quashing this year’s the results of the State engineering and pharmacy entrance examination. Minister says the government respects the verdict and will not move the Supreme Court

title: Kannada learning centres to be opened in Dharwad for officers of PSUs, govt. depts.
content: The KDA will set them up on the lines of those established in Bengaluru for helping non-Kannada speaking officials of govt. depts., banks, PSUs

title: Kappatralla will be first village in A.P. to be drug-free, says EAGLE Chief
content: IGP Ake Ravikrishna releases ‘Drugs Vaddu Bro’ posters intended to create awareness on the ill-effects of drugs among students and youth

title: Edappadi Palaniswami has become the BJP’s original voice: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: He criticises the AIADMK general secretary for his opposition to the establishment of schools and colleges under the HR and CE Department, and says there are legal provision under the HR and CE Act for this

title: Centre approves ₹1,066-crore for 6 disaster-hit States: Amit Shah
content: The Central Government has approved ₹1,066.80 crore for flood and landslide affected states of Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Kerala and Uttarakhand as part of the central share under SDRF

title: Naidu calls for collective efforts to protect, nurture schools
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu reiterates his government’s commitment to usher in a knowledge-driven, morally groomed student community

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Don’t interfere with sale, storage, transportation of raw chewable tobacco: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, the interim arrangement should continue until the Supreme Court passes further orders and an expert committee constituted by the Centre submits its report

title: Hassan heart attack deaths: Only 10 of 24 reported during May-June are confirmed cardiac deaths; 75% of deceased had known risk factors
content: As most of the deceased were autorickshaw and cab drivers, the committee has recommended cardiac screening for people in this occupation

title: Four persons held with 1.25 kg of MDMA
content: Besides the synthetic drug, the haul included 17 litres of foreign liquor, all purportedly smuggled in from Oman

title: V. Janaki vs State of Kerala to be submitted for re-censoring on Friday
content: Director says producers decided to give in to the demands of the censor board as releasing the film in the theatres at the earliest is the priority. The censor board had denied certification over the protagonist’s name of Janaki, another name of goddess Sita

title: Vigilance raids house of Muslim League leader Shaheed Kayikkaran over corruption allegations
content: He is the president of Madayi grama panchayat. Allegations have been raised over collection of rent of the buildings owned by the local body and corruption during his tenure as standing committee member

title: Nilgiris district a hotspot for negative human-gaur interactions in Tamil Nadu: study
content: Researchers note that the Nilgiris accounted for 174 incidents of human-gaur conflict between 2016 and 2024

title: Mehbooba calls for joint efforts to release Indian nurse facing death penalty in Yemen
content: As per Yemeni law, clemency is possible only through blood money. I request S Jaishankar (External Affairs Minister) to intervene immediately, says Former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti

title: Mid-air crash in Canada: Student pilot from India among two killed
content: The Indian pilot, identified as Sreehari Sukesh, was killed when his single-engine plane collided mid-air with another similar aircraft piloted by a Canadian youth, who was also killed in the accident

title: Criticism of Tharoor, Rahul's swipes at EC show Congress supports Emergency mindset: BJP
content: Rahul Gandhi's remarks during the protest in Bihar display a similar mindset that the legitimacy of constitutional bodies will be subject to his poll win or loss, says BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi

title: Explained: Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar and ‘fear of NRC’
content: Opposition is up in arms as Election Commission of India is conducting a ‘special intensive revision’ of electoral rolls in Bihar. Most fear a state-wide NRC is in the offing

title: Wild elephant attacks house of elderly couple at Kakkadampoyil in Kozhikode
content: A portion of the house was damaged in the attack. The couple had a narrow escape. Local residents allege poor response from Forest department squads

title: Union Minister to examine revival of CCI, SIIL units in Telangana
content: Telangana Industries Minister highlighted the potential to generate employment for youth and economic development through the revival.

title: Yadgir ZP CEO clarifies no one died by consuming contaminated water, deaths were result of prolonged ailments
content: He further said that necessary examinations were conducted on the water, which is supplied to villagers, and it was found to be potable

title: Chaldean Syrian Church Archbishop Mar Aprem Metropolitan laid to rest in Thrissur with State honours
content: The final burial rites were held at Kuruvilaachan Church by 2 p.m. Archbishop Mar Awgin Kuriakose led the service. Mar Aprem was laid to rest near the tombs of his predecessors in a specially prepared tomb

title: SFI march to Raj Bhavan against Kerala Governor’s ‘bid to saffronise State-run varsities’ turns violent
content: Scores of SFI activists march behind a cloth banner slamming Raj Bhavan-appointed temporary Vice Chancellor of Kerala University Mohanan Kunnumel as an ‘RSS stooge’

title: T.N. Minister slams Palaniswami over criticism of HR&CE-run educational institutions
content: Speaking to reporters in Chennai, Mr. Sekarbabu said, “It is highly condemnable that Mr. Palaniswami, unaware of the historical context, spoke like a mouthpiece of the BJP.”

title: 1998 Coimbatore serial blast key accused ‘Tailor’ Raja arrested in Karnataka after 29 years on the run
content: Raja, who was a member of the banned terror outfit Al Ummah that orchestrated the serial bombings, was brought to Coimbatore and produced before the Fifth Judicial Magistrate Court on Thursday (July 10)

title: Kerala University crisis deepens as agitations and administrative tussle rage on
content: Various Left-backed student and youth organisations intensify protests both inside and outside University of Kerala headquarters premises. Law enforcers use water cannons

title: Pregnant tribal woman in T.N.’s Thalavadi Hills ceases contact with health team over fear of hospital birth
content: In 2019 too, Shevanthi refused to visit the hospital for her first delivery. With police assistance, she was admitted to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital and delivered her first child, a girl, through a normal delivery. This time, fearing a possible C-section, she showed a strong preference for home delivery — a choice common among tribal women in the region.

title: Natural gas leaks from 2,866-metre-deep ONGC well while drilling in Konaseema; leak plugged
content: On being alerted by the locals about the incident, the district officials rushed to the spot and directed the ONGC authorities to stop the ongoing drilling activity with immediate effect

title: Hisar school principal stabbed to death by students
content: Teenage students allegedly killed principal over repeated reprimands; police probe role of criminal influence

title: Vijay condemns DMK government over ‘denial’ of subsidy to Tirunelveli fishermen for TVK affiliation
content: Mr. Vijay said a section of fishermen from Kootapuli village in Tirunelveli district, who are also TVK supporters, had painted the name of the party on their fishing boats. Government officials, however, informed them that they would not be eligible for subsidies if they continued to display the party’s name, he claimed

title: Include SC, ST, and OBC judges in Supreme Court, High Court collegiums to ensure social diversity: advocate forum
content: It writes to Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai stating that the inclusion could be done through internal reform, without requiring any legislative intervention

title: Final 2025 MLB draft rankings: Which college ace is No. 1 in our top 250 prospects?
content: I've updated my overall minor league top 100 rankings to make adjustments and remove graduated players so you can see roughly where the top players in the draft would slot on that list . this year's class is highlighted by a group of college left-handed pitchers near the top of the rankings .

title: Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at RB, DT and edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we compiled the results and ranked candidates based on number of top-10 votes, composite average and interviews . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position .

title: West: Should Minnesota, Houston or any West team scare OKC?
content: Oklahoma City's 2025-26 Eastern Conference race looks wide open due to star injuries . a mass of hopeful contenders must chase down the champion Oklahoma City Thunder . which veteran-laden teams hope to stay sufficiently spry for another deep playoff run?

title: ‘Hire me to unlock full potential’: Half-printed resume goes viral for bold twist
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: USMNT striker Downs seals move to Southampton
content: Damion Downs joins Southampton from FC Cologne on a four-year deal . the 21-year-old striker scored 10 goals and set up five more to help Cologne to promotion . downs will host high-profile Wrexham in opening game of second-tier championship .

title: Euro 2025 Daily: France cruise past Wales, England bounce back
content: the 2025 women's european championship has officially kicked off . we will update this file throughout each matchday with latest reporting, analysis and fun from the competition . a faultless performance against England , France were sloppy against Wales three days later .

title: Who had the NHL's best offseason? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .

title: The 30 players you need to pay attention to in summer league, from Atlanta to Washington
content: the 11-day tournament begins Thursday and runs through July 20 . the event will be headlined by the fresh faces of the 2025 draft class . top 2025 picks Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and VJ Edgecombe will all be in action .

title: 👀 MJ's former Chicago-area estate on Airbnb
content: the home, which sold for $9.5 million in December, became available for rental on Airbnb this month . the two-story estate, which was built in 1995, has seven bedrooms and 1712 bathrooms . it features a full-size basketball court, putting green, tennis court, cigar room and infinity pool .

title: Yankees DFA LeMahieu after 'hard conversations'
content: two-time batting champion DJ leMahieu was owed $22 million through next season . the move resulted from "an evolving conversation," manager Aaron Boone explained . it comes a day after Boone announced that jazz Chisholm Jr .

title: PLL Power Rankings heading into Week 7: Who's No. 1?
content: the PLL stages week 7 in Chicago on friday, July 11 and Saturday, July 12 . it's the first neutral tour stop of the regular season, meaning all eight teams are in action . half the teams are 3-2 and the other half are 2-3 .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Will casual boxing fans ever love Shakur Stevenson?
content: Shakur Stevenson will be matched against the organization's "interim" belt-holder, William Zepeda (33-0, 27 KOs) he's the third weight class in which he has now held titles . he is a huge source of consternation within the boxing business .
